page.title: 07BUCKFASTLEIGH CAVES
page.content: {Pengelly Centre}is the only cave centre in Buckfastleigh.When we visited it we saw{Reeds Cave.Reeds {Cave}is a roomy cave which has a small door in the roof leading to another cave.Mr Joint our guide told us about the invertebrates.Most of them are microscopic.There are the{flatworms which only live in the damp places as do the small{cave spiders}who spin their webs in the cave.Bats also live in the caves and they are mainly {Greater Horseshoe Bats.}The Bats go into the caves for their winter hibernation from October to April. {The Greater Horseshoe Bat}is recognised by its horseshoe shaped nose.The wingspan is 30 to 35cm wide. In flight the{Greater Horseshoe Bat}is 9cm long.The bats themselves are not birds as you may think but warm blooded mammals that can fly.
